availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Orlando Brown, Jr. (Frankfort, Kentucky, adjt. 22nd Ky Inf. and liet. col. 14th Ky Inf.)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Orlando Brown Sr., and Mary Watts Brown. Resident of Frankfort, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as adjutant from December 12, 1861, to January 10, 1862. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as major and lieutenant colonel from April 15, 1862, to August 9, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin, Frankfort, p. 237.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 96.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 271.
